function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Inaccurate representation of wastewater flows and population exposure to contaminants","Underestimation of potential pathogen transport and spread in the collection system","Errors in representation of wastewater flow rates and travel times","Variation in per-assay costs of clinical and WBE screening","High SARS-CoV-2 load in wastewater","Insufficient information on virus shedding by symptomatic and asymptomatic individuals","Potential loss of qRT-PCR signal in sewer from virus degradation and RNA loss","Lack of reliable data for loss of SARS-CoV-2 from in-sewer degradation under different temperature regimes","Impact of wastewater temperature on virus load stability and degradation","Neglecting the impact of temperature on degradation of biomarkers in wastewater","Significant under- or over-estimation of the true temporal changes occurring in virus shedding within the community","Financial interests in startup companies related to the study’s intellectual space","Disintegrated and non-interoperable data inhibits computer-assisted reasoning, hindering artificial intelligence","Propagation of contagious diseases through data sharing and integration","Risk of misinformation due to incomplete ontology-based approaches","Permanent changes in architectural design and lifestyle","Fast and unstoppable disease transmission due to high human mobility","Overload of hospitals and quarantine facilities","Increased risk of infectious disease transmission in built environments due to changes in living style and architecture","Reduced attachment to public places due to prolonged absence during lockdown","Exacerbation of existing inequalities and inequities due to COVID-19 impact","Unprecedented attention to cities and health","Inadequate recovery capability in the event of a disruptive event such as a contagious disease outbreak","Lack of organizational resilience","Lack of social resilience","Lack of understanding of resilience dimensions","Limited resilience in infrastructure systems","Unequal distribution of resilience research across different domains","Vulnerability to mass transportation system attacks"]}
